articles.author: Will Dunham
articles.description: Jimmy Carter, the earnest Georgia peanut farmer who as U.S. president struggled with a bad economy and the Iran hostage crisis but brokered peace between Israel and Egypt and later received the Nobel Peace Prize for his humanitarian work, died at his home in Plains, Georgia, on Sunday, the Carter Center said. He was 100.
articles.title: Jimmy Carter, former US president and Nobel Peace Prize recipient, dead at 100

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hongji Kim
articles.description: Investigators are examining bird strikes and weather conditions as possible factors in the crash.
articles.title: South Korea orders air safety probe after worst crash in country kills 179

articles.author: Stephen Grey, John Shiffman, Grant Smith
articles.description: Chemicals factories founded or owned by some of Russia's wealthiest men are supplying ingredients to plants that manufacture explosives used by Moscow's military during the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Exclusive: The Russian billionaires whose chemical factories fuel Russia's war machine

articles.author: Ramadan Abed, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Yahya Al-Batran woke up in the early hours of Sunday morning to find his wife, Noura trying to wake their newborn twin sons Jumaa and Ali as they lay together in the makeshift tent the family occupied in an encampment in the central Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Displaced Gaza newborn freezes to death and twin fights for his life as rain floods tents

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Khalil Ashawi, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Syria's new rulers have installed some foreign fighters including Uyghurs, a Jordanian and a Turk in the country's armed forces as Damascus tries to shape a patchwork of rebel groups into a professional military, two Syrian sources said.
articles.title: Syria appoints some foreign Islamist fighters to its military, sources say

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden announced $2.5 billion in additional security assistance for Ukraine on Monday as he uses his final weeks in office to surge military aid to Kyiv before President-elect Donald Trump takes power.
articles.title: Biden announces $2.5 billion in fresh military aid to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's interior minister said on Monday it was still too soon to jump to any conclusions about the man suspected of driving his car into a Christmas market in Magdeburg and killing at least five people.
articles.title: Too early to jump to conclusions over German Christmas market attack, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un pledged to solidify the country's comprehensive strategic partnership with Russia in his letter to President Vladimir Putin on Monday, state media KCNA reported on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim vows to further solidify Russia ties in letter to Putin

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swiss International Air Lines said on Monday a member of its cabin crew who ended up in intensive care last week when the flight he was on suffered engine problems and smoke inside the plane, has died in hospital.
articles.title: Swiss cabin crew member dies after flight with smoke problems

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syria's de facto ruler Ahmed al-Sharaa held talks on Monday with a senior Ukrainian delegation led by Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha, the Syrian state news agency (SANA) reported, as Kyiv moves to build ties with the new leadership in Damascus.
articles.title: Syria's de facto leader hosts Ukraine's foreign minister, SANA says
